result.execSummary:
The defendant Deven Matthias Seifert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

1:07  Defendant Deven Matthias Seifert in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Victim  S S is present in the courtroom and is sworn in.  He presents his claim to the court. Judge exams the witness.Helgeson x-exams   Exh 1 Summary Aetna Ins.  Exh 2 Allina billing  Exh 3 RFEMS billing  Exh 1,2,3 are received by the court.   Devin Seifert is sw and exam by Helgeson.Exh 4 Photos of Devin Seifert.  Exh 4 is offered and received.   Court finds $200.00 is the amount of restitutuion to be paid by  Devin Seifert  and whatever the insurance does not pay defendant will have to pay in addition to the $200.

4:04 p.m.  Defendant Deven Matthias Seifert in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan - parties have a plea agreement to  amended charge.  Helgeson agrees.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to amended charge of disorderly conduct.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty of amended charge and adjudicates defendant guilty.  O'Sullivan addresses court regarding sentencing.  Helgeson addresses the court regarding sentencing.  Court orders:  S/W, Probation - 1 year, conditions to be set by agent.  Expungment upon successful completion of probation. Court costs in the amount of $463.00 including DNA surcharge.   No restitution ordered today.  Set for restitution hearing.
from Atty OSullivan requesting a continue of final pretrial due to a conflict.

Final pre-trial at 11-10-2015 03:00 pm.
Jury trial at 12-03-2015 08:30 am.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea to count 1 at preliminary hearing.  Pretrial Conference to be set.    The bond will continue as ordered.  Court reviews bond conditions with defendant.

11:05 a.m.  Defendant Deven Matthias Seifert in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No motions have been filed.  O'Sullivan files amended information, misdemeanor battery.  O'Sullivan moves to modify bond conditions to no abusive contact.  Helgeson has no objections to amending bond conditions.  Court modifies bond conditions to no abusive contact.
Def pleas not guilty. Court receives and enters. Bond to remain.

2:30 Defendant Deven Matthias Seifert in court with attorney Christopher Anderson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Luke Schladweiler swn, ex by Thorie. ID's defendant. Court: record will reflect indentification. Atty Anderson x ex. court finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings. Thorie files the information; Def has a copy. Def waives the reading.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Def waives his right to have his preliminary hearing within 20 days.

3:36 Defendant Deven Matthias Seifert in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears in court with Def,  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charge and maximum penalty on the record.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. OSullivan: $5000 signature bond; no contact with victim. Nelson has no objection. Defendant does not qualify for the services of the PD. Def has not been in the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
